DIDANOSINE

NUCLEOSIDE REVERSE TRANSCRIPTASE INHIBITORS

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

HIV infection in combination with other antiretroviral drugs,

By mouth

  • For adults (body-weight up to 60 kg)
    250 mg daily in 1–2 divided doses.
  • For adults (body-weight 60 kg and above)
    400 mg daily in 1–2 divided doses.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit outweighs risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Insufficient information.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Reduce dose if eGFR less than 60 mL/minute/1.73 m2; consult product literature.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Acute renal failure, alopecia, anaphylactic reactions, diabetes mellitus, dry eyes, dry mouth, hyperuricaemia (suspend if raised significantly), hypoglycaemia, liver failure, non-cirrhotic portal hypertension, optic nerve changes, pancreatitis (less common in children), parotid gland enlargement, peripheral neuropathy (switch to another antiretroviral if peripheral neuropathy develops), retinal changes, rhabdomyolysis, sialadenitis,

Pancreatitis

Suspend treatment if serum lipase raised (even if asymptomatic) or if symptoms of pancreatitis develop; discontinue if pancreatitis confirmed. Whenever possible avoid concomitant treatment with other drugs known to cause pancreatic toxicity (e.g. intravenous pentamidine isetionate); monitor closely if concomitant therapy unavoidable. Since significant elevations of triglycerides cause pancreatitis monitor closely if elevated.

Directions for administration

With chewable tablets, to ensure sufficient antacid, each dose to be taken as at least 2 tablets (child under 1 year 1 tablet) chewed thoroughly, crushed or dispersed in water; clear apple juice may be added for flavouring; tablets to be taken 2 hours after lopinavir with ritonavir capsules and oral solution or atazanavir with ritonavir.

Capsules should be swallowed whole and taken at least 2 hours before or 2 hours after food.

Advice for patients and carers

Patients or carers should be given advice on how to administer didanosine capsules and chewable tablets.

Cautions regarding administration

  • History of pancreatitis (preferably avoid, otherwise extreme caution)
  • hyperuricaemia
  • peripheral neuropathy

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Ophthalmological examination (including visual acuity, colour vision, and dilated fundus examination) recommended annually or if visual changes occur.

Prepared medicinal forms of DIDANOSINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Chewable tablet
Gastro-resistant capsule
